intro: Phymatidium geiselii, commonly known as the desert dandelion, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble dandelions. The plant has hairy, gray-green leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. It is adapted to thrive in harsh, dry environments with minimal water requirements. Phymatidium geiselii plays a role in stabilizing soils and providing nectar for pollinators in its native habitat.
